definition: continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
variant of 聯綿詞|联绵词[lian2 mian2 ci2]

sentences.english: The reason Burundi is so poor is because they have never really had any peaceful time between the everlasting civil wars.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家貧窮的真正原因是因爲連綿不絕的內戰。

sentences.english: There is a reach of grassland in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 遠處是連綿一片的草原。

sentences.english: The mountain ridges in this area twist and twine, stretching endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 這個山區的山脈蜿蜒曲折，連綿不絕。

sentences.english: These cloudy days depress us all.
In the central regions you'll encounter rugged land and rolling hills.
sentences.chinese: 在中部地區，你會遇到崎嶇的土地和連綿起伏的丘陵。

sentences.english: River flows from north-east across the area to the southwest, rolling 50 Wa Lane.
sentences.chinese: 流溪河從該區東北部橫貫至西南部，連綿50華里。

sentences.english: Wright envisaged the Guggenheim as “a curving wave that never breaks.”
sentences.chinese: 萊特把古根海姆看作是“永不斷裂的連綿曲線”。

sentences.english: In all that sprawling city, there was everything except an end. There was no end.
sentences.chinese: 連綿不絕的城市，什麼都有，除了盡頭，沒有盡。

sentences.english: The epidemic disease in the Wei, Jin, Sixteen States and Northern Dynasties spread continuously.
sentences.chinese: 魏晉十六國北朝疫病流行呈現出連綿不斷的趨勢。

sentences.english: A small town named Forks exists under a near-constant cover of clounds.
sentences.chinese: 一個叫福克斯的小鎮總是陰雨連綿。

sentences.english: The south and north dynasties was a great abruption period.
sentences.chinese: 南北朝是中國歷史上大分裂時期，戰爭連綿不絕。

sentences.english: On holidays, we can see a continuous line of cars on highways.
sentences.chinese: 在假期，我們能看到高速公路上連綿不斷的車流。

sentences.english: Some days were depressing, the way the weeks of rain and cloudy skies became depressing to me when we lived in Seattle.
sentences.chinese: 在西雅圖，連綿數週的陰雨天氣讓人沮喪。

sentences.english: A series of wet days spoils our holiday.
sentences.chinese: 陰雨連綿破壞了我們的假期。

sentences.english: Every day, it seems, we're flooded with pop-psych advice about happiness.
sentences.chinese: 每天，關於如何快樂的各種建議猶如洪水，連綿不絕。

sentences.english: The medium extends unbroken from star to star .
sentences.chinese: 這種媒質連綿不斷地從一個星體擴展到另一個星體。

definition: continuous (esp. of mountain ranges)/to stretch long and unbroken/a continuous link/sostenuto (sustained, in music)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
